org.hps.readout.rawconverter

Class AbstractMode1RawConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.readout.rawconverter.AbstractBaseRawConverter
      • org.hps.readout.rawconverter.AbstractMode1RawConverter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EcalMode1RawConverter, HodoscopeMode1RawConverter

    public abstract class AbstractMode1RawConverter
extends AbstractBaseRawConverter
    AbstractMode1RawConverter provides functionality for the AbstractBaseRawConverter for the handling of Mode-1 hits. It also includes hooks to allow for pulse-fitting of Mode-1 ADC buffers, but does not itself support this behavior.

    AbstractMode3RawConverter does not implement any behavior that is specific to a subdetector. That is left for its implementing drivers.
    See Also:
    AbstractBaseRawConverter

    • Field Detail

      • integrationThreshold

        private double integrationThreshold
        The threshold (defined as over pedestal) at which pulse integration begins. This time of the threshold-crossing sample is also used to determine the hit time. Units are ADC.

      • nPeak

        private int nPeak
        The maximum number of threshold-crossings that may be integrated in one ADC buffer.

      • mode7

        private boolean mode7
        Specifies whether or not to output hits with Mode-7 additional data or not. If false, Mode-3 style hits will be produced instead.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMode1RawConverter

        public AbstractMode1RawConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • convertHit

        public ArrayList<CalorimeterHit> convertHit(RawTrackerHit hit)
        Converts a Mode-1 ADC buffer RawTrackerHit object to a CalorimeterHit object with calibrated energy and time values. Both Mode-3 and Mode-7 style output is support by this method.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to convert.
        Returns:
        Returns the converted hit.

      • setMaximumThresholdCrossings

        public void setMaximumThresholdCrossings(int nPeak)
        Sets the maximum number of threshold-crossings that may be integrated in one ADC buffer. Allowed values are 1, 2 or 3.
        Parameters:
        nPeak - - The maximum number of threshold-crossings.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if any value other than 1, 2, or 3 is given.

      • setMode7

        public void setMode7(boolean mode7)
        Specifies whether or not output hits should include the additional Mode-7 information or not.
        Parameters:
        mode7 - - true means that Mode-7 information should be included, and false that only Mode-3 information will be output.

      • convertWaveformToPulse

        protected double[] convertWaveformToPulse(RawTrackerHit hit,
                                          int thresholdCrossing)
        Performs pulse integration of the ADC buffer stored in the argument hit and outputs the results. These results include:
        • The pulse time
        • The integrated ADC sum
        • The Mode-7 "minimum ADC" value
        • The Mode-7 "maximum ADC" value
        • The fit quality
        Note that this driver does not implement pulse-fitting. This final value in the returned data is included for the benefit of implementing drivers.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit.
        thresholdCrossing - - The threshold-crossing sample where upon the integration window is centered.
        Returns:
        Returns the integration data as a double array of the form { TIME, ADC_SUM, MODE7_MIN_ADC, MODE7_MAX_ADC, FIT_QUALITY }.
